result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Leroy Morford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Unpaid court costs are to be converted to civil judgment.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Concurrent to 15CF125.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to have no contact with Blair Express Mart, Jessica Ness, or Kristina Berger.
Upon successful completion of probation, defendant may apply for expungement.
Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.  Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.  Defendant is to participate in Recovery Court.

timeConds.notes: Imposed and stayed if defendant successfully completes Recovery Court.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay court costs and DNA surcharge.  Unpaid costs are to be converted to civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Leroy Morford
